params.break_ratio_policy: ratio_lo defaults to 1/ratio_hi (symmetric inverse) unless overridden

audit.hold_days_semantics: entry day sets hold_days=0; increments by 1 each subsequent row while in position
audit.same_day_reentry: not allowed; exit day is always flat
audit.interest_semantics: row-based accrual while in position; includes the first row after entry (may be interpreted as entry-day accrual depending on timing assumption)
audit.end_of_data_policy: if open position exists at end, force-close and record trade with exit_reason=end_of_data
audit.equity_csv_last_row_note: if open_at_end=true, last equity value is mark-to-market while still in position; numerically equivalent to post-close equity at the same last_price, but trade record is added after loop
audit.lever_leg_pnl_semantics: gross P&L for leverage leg (proceeds - principal); net_after_costs = lever_leg_pnl - interest_paid - cost_paid
audit.slippage_model: cash penalty = notional * slip_rate per side; slip_rate = slip_bps * 1e-4
audit.forbid_mask_semantics: for each break idx b: forbid entry i in [b-contam_horizon, b+z_clear_days-1]

segmentation.notes: Each segment equity is normalized to 1.0 at its own start (base_shares=1/segment_first_price). Segment results are NOT chainable into a single continuous equity curve. If --out_post_equity_csv is used, the CSV is produced from the SAME post segment run (no recompute).
